member.name: M:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Data.DataItemProxyFactory.GetProxy(System.String,Neo.ApplicationFramework.Interfaces.IScreen)
member.summary: The purpose with this overloaded method is that it can be called from script, in order to get a proxy that ends up in the recorded proxy list, even after EndRecordProxies have been called, and thereby gets refreshed by the update timer in screen. The tag also gets activated and later on deactivated when closing the screen, but it's not batch activated.
member.param: Full name of tag to get proxy for.
Reference to the screen to record this proxy for.
member.returns: A dataitem proxy for the tag.

member.name: M:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Data.DataItemProxyFactory.DeactivateProxies(System.String)
member.summary: Disconnects data items without removing them.

member.name: M:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Data.DataItemProxyFactory.SetActivityOnDataItemProxies(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Activates or deactivates DataItemProxyActivity without adding connected clients
member.param: proxy cookie name
true to activate, false to deactivate

member.name: M:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Data.DataItemProxyFactory.GetNonRefreshedProxy``1(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,``0})
member.summary: This method provides a way to get a DataItemProxy that does not connect(and hence refresh values) This is really a temporary workaround for case #13740. The base problem is that getting a proxy should never invoke a connect, and atleast should not provoke a refresh of values. Any connect or refresh of value should be explicit.

member.name: M:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Data.DynamicBinding.ReadValue
member.summary: Push data from source to destination Calling ReadValue on bindings not added in DCBC via base.AddCore will have some properties set to null, hence ReadValue will throw exception. This method will make the distinction and bypass ReadValue for bindings supporting optimized binding (i.e. pushing the data directly)

member.name: P:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Printer.Document.TableRow.AutoHeight
member.summary: AutoHeight will tell the TableRow to use as much space vertically as is needed by the table rows content.

member.name: T:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Printer.GdiPrinter.BitmapPrintImageToGdiConverter
member.summary: Converts a bitmap image into a device context that can be used with native Gdi methods.

member.name: T:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Printer.GdiPrinter.BlockCollectionLayout
member.summary: BlockCollectionLayout performs layout of all child layout elements. Layout elements are always stacked on top of each other much like how a StackPanel works in WPF when it has its Orientation set to vertical.

member.name: T:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Printer.GdiPrinter.BlockLayoutElement
member.summary: BlockLayoutElement is a base for layout elements that wish to provide padding to the contained content.

member.name: T:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Printer.GdiPrinter.DeviceDependentThickness
member.summary: Represents a thickness on the four sides of a rectangle. In contrast to the Thickness class these values are calculated based on the resolution of the device and units are in pixels.

member.name: T:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Printer.GdiPrinter.BlockLayoutFactory
member.summary: Factory for converting a FlowDocument Block into the corresponding layout element.

member.name: T:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Printer.GdiPrinter.FlowDocumentLayout
member.summary: FlowDocumentLayout performs layout of FlowDocument. The layout is adapted to the available space which is dependent on the (printer)device is used. FlowDocumentLayout will construct a tree of sub-layout elements all in charge of performing layout on a subset of the original flow document.

member.name: T:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Printer.GdiPrinter.ImageLayout
member.summary: Performs layout of a FlowDocument PrintImage.

member.name: T:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Printer.GdiPrinter.InlineCollectionLayout
member.summary: Performs layout of a list of inlines (e.g. texts/spans). Unlike blocks inlines continue on the same row until the end is reached. Dependening on the TextWrapping the inlines may continue on the next row (TextWrapping.Wrap) or the inline may be chopped (TextWrapping.NoWrap).

member.name: T:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Printer.GdiPrinter.InlineLayout
member.summary: Performs layout on a FlowDocument Inline. Currently this class is hardcoded to layout Spans (which is a inline element).

member.name: T:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Printer.GdiPrinter.NullPrintImageToGdiConverter
member.summary: A null converter to convert a GdiImage (i.e. a device context) to DeviceContext. Since GdiImage already provide a device context no conversion is needed, hence the null prefix.

member.name: T:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Printer.GdiPrinter.ParagraphLayout
member.summary: Performs layout of a FlowDocument Paragraph. A paragraph consists of a number of inline elements, typically spans.

member.name: T:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Printer.GdiPrinter.TableLayout
member.summary: Performs layout of a FlowDocument Table. TableLayout arranges the content in a grid.

member.name: M:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Runtime.GlobalsBase.SetWinFormsThreadExceptionMode
member.summary: By setting SetUnhandledExceptionMode on full framework to ThrowException (1) it behaves the same on both real Compact Framework and on full Framework.

member.name: M:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Runtime.GlobalsBase.GetObject``1(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Returns an existing instance of instanceType or creates a new instance of it.

member.name: M:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Runtime.GlobalsBase.GetObjects``1
member.summary: Finds all objects of specified type or inherited from that type.
member.typeparam: Type of objects to search for.
member.returns: All objects of the specified type or inherited from the type.

member.name: M:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Runtime.GlobalsBase.GetInstances``1
member.summary: Finds all objects of specified type (or those assignable from) that were designer-generated. (e.g. AlarmServer, SecurityManager)
member.returns: Iterator over found instances of matching type.

member.summary: Implemented explicitly in order to not collide with a designer having the same name.

member.summary: Implemented explicitly in order to not collide with a designer having the same name.

The security extender to add.

member.name: M:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Security.SecurityGroupHelper.FlagGroup(Neo.ApplicationFramework.Interfaces.SecurityGroups,Neo.ApplicationFramework.Interfaces.SecurityGroups)
member.summary: Flags a security group, by using bitwise 'or' on the enumeration and the group.
member.param: Security groups enumeration to manipulate.
Group to flag in enumeration.
member.returns: A security groups enumeration with the specified group flagged.

member.name: M:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Security.SecurityGroupHelper.UnflagGroup(Neo.ApplicationFramework.Interfaces.SecurityGroups,Neo.ApplicationFramework.Interfaces.SecurityGroups)
member.summary: Unflags a security group, by using bitwise 'and' on the enumeration and the inverted group.
member.param: Security groups enumeration to manipulate.
Group to unflag in enumeration.
member.returns: A security groups enumeration with the specified group unflagged.

member.name: M:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Security.SecurityGroupHelper.IsAnyGroupFlagged(Neo.ApplicationFramework.Interfaces.SecurityGroups,Neo.ApplicationFramework.Interfaces.SecurityGroups)
member.summary: Checks if any group is flagged in another security groups enumeration.
member.param: Security groups enumeration to check among.
Groups to check if flagged.
member.returns: True if any of the groups is flagged, false otherwise.

members.member: Reads the "Object" tag. This returns an instance of the newly created object. Returns null if there was an error.

member.summary: This method must be invoked on the main thread since the InvokerControl must be created on the window thread.

member.summary: Begins running a standard application message loop on the current thread, and makes the specified form visible.
member.param: A screen type to make visible.

member.returns: The startup path for the application.

member.summary: This function will show the notification message for at least timeoutInSeconds. If HideNotification is called after the time has elapsed this will be the actual time the message is shown.

member.summary: Identifier of the process. The contents of this member can be used by Win32 API elements.

member.summary: Number of references to the process. Must be 1.

member.name: P:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Utilities.ProcessInfo.ProcessExe
member.summary: The path and file name of the executable file for the process.

member.name: P:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Utilities.ProcessInfo.DefaultHeapID
member.summary: Identifier of the default heap for the process. The contents of this member has meaning only to the tool help functions. It is not a handle, nor is it usable by Win32 API elements.

member.name: P:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Utilities.ProcessInfo.ModuleID
member.summary: Module identifier of the process. Must be 0.

member.name: P:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Utilities.ProcessInfo.ThreadCount
member.summary: Number of execution threads started by the process.

member.name: P:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Utilities.ProcessInfo.ParentProcessID
member.summary: Identifier of the process that created the process being examined. Must be 0.

member.name: P:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Utilities.ProcessInfo.PriClassBase
member.summary: Base priority of any threads created by this process. Value is always THREAD_PRIORITY_NORMAL

member.name: P:Neo.ApplicationFramework.Common.Utilities.ProcessInfo.Flags
